meanings.definition: Relating to the cheek or mouth.
meanings.sent1: The dentist applied a buccal numbing gel before the procedure.
meanings.sent2: She felt a slight buccal swelling after biting her cheek.
meanings.sent3: The buccal examination made the child giggle uncontrollably.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was like a buccal sunrise, spreading warmth to everyone around.
meanings.sent5: The buccal pain was sharp, like a tiny needle poking her cheek.

meanings.definition: Located in or directed toward the cheek or mouth.
meanings.sent1: The buccal cavity housed the dissolving tablet.
meanings.sent2: He pointed to the buccal side of the tooth for the X-ray.
meanings.sent3: The buccal direction confused the lost hiker even more.
meanings.sent4: Her words were a buccal whisper, meant only for his ears.
meanings.sent5: The buccal taste of the medicine lingered long after swallowing.
